sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>dirt</radical> <radical>nurse</radical> is someone who nurses dirt. When nursed, dirt becomes <kanji>soil</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Soil generally has more nutrients in it. It makes sense for dirt that's been nursed to become soil.
readingMnemonic: <kanji>Soil</kanji> is a thing <reading>Jou</reading>rm (<ja>じょう</ja>) the huge farmhand works on improving. If he makes the soil better, the farm will yield more crops.
readingInfo: Imagine Jourm working with soil (not dirt!). Improving it by mixing in various ingredients. The soil this year is particularly lush, for some reason...
